text: In vector calculus, the curl is a vector operator that describes the infinitesimal rotation of a vector field in three-dimensional Euclidean space. At every point in the field, the curl of that point is represented by a vector. Curl is an extension of torque. Given a vector field \mathbf{F}, the curl of \mathbf{F} can be written as \operatorname{curl}\mathbf{F} or abla \times \mathbf{F}, where abla is the gradient and \times is the cross product operation. == Related pages == * Divergence == References == Category:Calculus Category:Mathematical analysis
title: Curl
